title: Mobile-friendly Valentine prompt for Mr. Bingus (Yes/No with playful evade + success meme)

requirements.summary: Build a single mobile-friendly page that asks the Valentine question with exactly two actions: Yes and No.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the question "Mr. Bingus, will you be my Valentine?".
Exactly two actionable buttons are visible: "Yes" and "No".
Layout is usable on common iOS mobile browser sizes (no horizontal scrolling; tap targets are comfortably sized).

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine prompt UI in React with the exact prompt text and exactly two actionable buttons ("Yes" and "No"). If available, use the shadcn-ui Button component to provide consistent button styling and accessible tap targets; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the app renders the new single-page App as the only interactive experience (no extra routes/pages), keeping mobile-first layout constraints in mind.

requirements.summary: Make the No button evade taps/clicks and spawn multiple ðŸ¥º emojis around the screen on each attempt.
acceptanceCriteria: Attempting to tap/click the "No" button causes it to move to a different position within the visible viewport (not off-screen).
Each "No" attempt spawns multiple visible 'ðŸ¥º' emojis at varied positions around the screen.
The "No" button continues to evade repeated attempts (not a one-time move).
The interaction works with touch input (iOS Safari) as well as mouse input.

file_operations.description: Implement the evasive "No" behavior: on pointer/touch interaction (e.g., onPointerDown/onTouchStart and/or onPointerEnter for hover), reposition the button within viewport-safe bounds and append multiple ðŸ¥º emoji pop elements at randomized positions; keep the button always visible and avoid layout jank on mobile.
Add CSS animations/styles for emoji pops (e.g., fade/float/scale) and a lightweight overlay container so emojis appear around the screen without causing horizontal scrolling.

requirements.summary: On Yes, replace the prompt with a success view that shows the meme image and the exact caption text.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping/clicking "Yes" transitions to a new view/state that hides the "Yes"/"No" buttons.
The success view displays the meme image (bundled as a static asset) and the exact caption text: "aww good choice ðŸ¥°".
The success view is centered and mobile-friendly (image scales responsively without overflowing).

file_operations.description: Add the "Yes" flow state: hide the question/buttons after activation and render a centered success view that displays the static meme image and the exact caption text "aww good choice ðŸ¥°"; ensure the image is responsive (max-width constraints) for iOS Safari.
Add success-view layout styling (centering, responsive image constraints) so the meme image scales down on small screens and never overflows the viewport.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive Valentine theme (pink/white/red) with a simple card-like style and playful, non-distracting animations.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI colors are pink/white/red (no default/unstyled template look).
Typography and spacing feel like a simple Valentine card (clear hierarchy: prompt > buttons).
Animations (No-button evade + emoji pops) match the theme and do not cause severe layout jank on mobile.

file_operations.description: Implement the Valentine theme using existing global styling entry points: set a pink/white/red palette, card-like container styling (rounded corners/shadow), heart/paper-like background texture (CSS-based), and tuned animation timing to stay playful without being distracting.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (colors/animations) as needed to support a consistent Valentine palette and subtle motion utilities used by the page.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated image under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it directly from the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI loads the image(s) via a static path and displays them in the "Yes" success view.
No backend endpoints are added/required to fetch or generate the image at runtime.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-yes-meme.dim_1024x1024.png.

Reference and render the generated image from the success view via its static asset path (frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-yes-meme.dim_1024x1024.png) and ensure it is displayed together with the exact caption text.
